definition.name: NXstm
definition.doc: An application definition to describe Scanning Tunneling Microscopy (STM).

field.name: definition
field.doc: Name of the definition that is used for the application.

field.name: scan_mode
field.doc: The mode of the scan that is performed. Two commonly used ones are constant height mode and constant current mode.

group.name: experiment_instrument
group.doc: The group explains the instrumentation of the STM experiment such as current sensor, lock-in amplifier etc.

group.name: lockin_amplifier
group.doc: The lock-in amplifier information. The device is being used to extract the very weak signal buried in noisy signals.

field.name: modulation_signal_type
field.doc: The type of the signal (voltage or current) subject fo modulation.

field.name: modulation_frequency
field.doc: The frequency of the sine modulation that is used to modulate the signal in lock-in.

group.name: scan_environment
group.doc: The environment information for stm or sts experiment.
The scan control information like scan region or phase space, type of scan (e.g. mesh, spiral, etc.), and scan speed, etc.

field.name: scan_type
field.doc: The type of scan like mesh, spiral, etc. For STS experiment, the scan type is usually a single-point scan (trajectory scan).

group.name: tip_temp_sensor
group.doc: This group stands for the same concept as /ENTRY[entry]/experiment_instrument/tip_temperature

group.name: cryo_temp_sensor
group.doc: This group stands for the same concept as /ENTRY[entry]/experiment_instrument/cryo_temperature

group.name: cryo_shield_temp_sensor
group.doc: This group stands for the same concept as /ENTRY[entry]/experiment_instrument/cryo_shield_temperature

group.name: tip_temp_sensor
group.doc: The temperature of the tip one of the tip.

group.name: cryo_temp_sensor
group.doc: The temperature of the cryostat.

group.name: cryo_shield_temp_sensor
group.doc: The temperature of the cryo shield.

group.name: current_sensor
group.doc: The sensor information.

field.name: current
field.doc: The tunneling current between tip and sample after applying bias voltage.

field.name: current_offset
field.doc: Offset value of the current measurement.

group.name: current_calibration
group.doc: Calibration of the current measurement.

field.name: coefficients
field.doc: The coefficients of the calibration.

group.doc: An amplifier information for the input signal (e.g. from tip).

field.name: current_gain
field.doc: Proportional relationship between the probe output voltage and the actual tunneling current when measuring the tunneling current.

group.name: bias_spectroscopy_environment
group.doc: To explain bias (sweep measurement) voltage applied to the sample.

Setup and scan data for continuous measurement of bias-voltage on the subject of experiment vs tunneling current from probe. Data from from this experiment can also be used to calculate the dI/dV spectra.

group.name: piezo_sensor
group.doc: The sensor information for the piezo device.

group.name: piezo_configuration
group.doc: The piezo configuration information like piezoelectric device calibration and material properties.

group.name: calibration
group.doc: Calibration of the piezo device.

field.name: 2nd_order_correction_N
field.doc: The N (substring) denotes X and Y directions. The 2nd order piezo compensate the error for that axis. The following equation shows the interpretation of the 2nd order correction parameters, For the X-piezo: "Ux = 1/cx 路 X + cxx 路 X2" with units: "[V] = [V/m] 路 [m] + [V/m2] 路 [m2]" where cx is the calibration of the piezo X and cxx is the 2nd order correction. The unit for such the second-order correction is (V/m^2).

field.name: calibration_type
field.doc: The name of the calibration type, sometimes it is called e.g active calibration, passive calibration.

field.name: calibration_coefficient_N
field.doc: The calibration coefficient is the ratio of the actual distance moved by the piezo to the voltage applied to the piezo. It is also called first-order correction.

field.name: drift_N
field.doc: Set up the settings to enable or disable the drift compensation.

field.name: drift_correction_status
field.doc: Whether the drift has been corrected in case there is a deviation in the drift.

field.name: tilt_N
field.doc: The N (substring) denotes X and Y directions, and for both directions tilt needs to be adjusted according to the actual surface.

field.name: hv_gain_N
field.doc: The N (substring) denotes X or Y or Z. In some systems, there is an HV gain readout feature. For these systems, the HV gain should be automatically adjusted whenever the gain is changed at the high voltage amplifier.

group.doc: The positioner information like the position of the tip, PID loop feedback etc.

group.name: z_controller
group.doc: The PID controller information for the z-axis.

field.name: z
field.doc: To indicate the relative tip position z between tip and sample. The tip position can also be varied when the z_controller is not running.

field.name: set_point
field.doc: The set point for the z-controller to be fixed and the target value could be height or current.

field.name: controller_name
field.doc: The name of the controller or channels.

field.name: controller_status
field.doc: The status of the controller to say was PID has been used or not.

field.name: tip_lift
field.doc: If the tip is lifted from the stable point.

field.name: switch_off_delay
field.doc: The switch-off delay of the controller from its stable point.

group.name: reproducibility_indicators
group.doc: The group's concepts hold the link to the related concepts that define the reproducibility of the STM experiment.

field.name: current_offset

field.name: modulation_frequency

group.name: resolution_indicators
group.doc: The group's concepts hold the link to the related concepts that define the resolution of the STM experiment.
